title: Uptick in SBP reserves - Business - DAWN.COM
content:
KARACHI: Foreign exchange reserves held by the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP) increased by $13 million to reach $14.256 billion for the week ending Aug 15.

According to a report issued by the central bank on Thursday, the countryâ€™s overall liquid foreign reserves stood at $19.570bn. This includes $5.314bn held by commercial banks.

Published in Dawn, August 22th, 2025
